item.title: My wish list
item.description: Just in case you would like to get me something… Amazon Wishlist REI Wishlist Item Where Estimated Price Notes Mushroom Jerky Various retailers Spotify Premium Various retailers California car duster Various retailers Downside to a black car is how quickly it gets dusty.

item.title: 2022 Switzerland Pack List
item.description: I recently had the fortune of going to Switzerland to visit with my friend in and around Bern. Using my friend’s place as a home base, we did several bike loops out of Bern, including a few train assisted sections and an overnight trip.

item.title: From Android back to iOS: Why I bought the new iPhone SE (2022)
item.description: The web has had some harsh words for this phone before it even shipped. Now Apple is scaling back production based on weak demand.

item.title: Moved to Hugo from Gatsby
item.description: With this post, I can say that I have successfully completed moving my website from GatsbyJS to Hugo and in the process did some neat things with it.

item.title: RAGBRAI XLVIII Recap
item.description: Knolling my RAGBRAI packlist I just got back from another year of RAGBRAI. Wasn’t sure if it would actually happen because of the new wave of COVID-19 cases.

item.title: 2021 Boundary Waters Canoe Area Trip
item.description: At the beginning of June this year, I went on a five-night canoe camping trip with family members in the Boundary Waters Canoe Area (BWCA), specifically the Shell Lake area off entry point 14.

item.title: 2020 Ski Trip Pack List
item.description: I went on a short weekend ski trip to Park City, UT. I don’t have a photo of my items, but if you have seen my North Face Recon backpack, it was completely stuffed.

item.title: A case against social media timeline widgets
item.description: We get it all the time at my work. “Can I put my Facebook timeline on my website?” Absolutely not. Here is why.

item.title: 2019 NYC Pack List
item.description: Going into Labor Day weekend, Abby and I traveled to New York City to attend my buddy’s wedding as well as celebrate our 10-year wedding anniversary.

item.title: So I Became a Vegetarian
item.description: My wife heard it from the mayor. Two weeks ago, I jumped right into it. I became a vegetarian, but kept it to myself.

item.title: Hello Gatsby
item.description: Jekyll has served me well for several years, but I am interested in trying something new. GastbyJS has caught my attention because it uses Node instead of Ruby which is what I have been using for work and Gastby has plugins that integrate with Drupal, something I might look into later.

item.title: We have a budget
item.description: This is a re-write of a post I authored back in 2017. Our situation has changed enough since I first wrote about budgeting that I didn’t feel like it was useful anymore as-is.

item.title: Optimizing GeoJSON
item.description: I have been working with some GeoJSON files lately for work and at first I was having issues with the large size of the files.

item.title: Follow-Up: RAGBRAI XLV (2017) Pack List
item.description: Knolling my RAGBRAI packlist Here is a follow-up to my previous post, 2017-ragbrai-packlist. Based on this year, I made some last minute decisions on what to pack.

item.title: RAGBRAI XLV (2017) Pack List
item.description: Knolling my RAGBRAI packlist I have been on RAGBRAI (Des Moines Register’s Annual Great Bike Ride Across Iowa) several times since 2005.

item.title: Converting a website from Drupal to Jekyll

item.title: Hello world
item.description: giving jekyll another go.

item.title: About
item.description: I am a web developer focusing on Drupal with the University of Iowa in Iowa City, IA. I am a husband and father of two.

item.title: Obsidian - My hub for almost everything
item.description: I’ve been using Obsidian for over a year. It started off as my daily journal that was backed up to a private repo in Gitlab and rendered using Hugo (accessible only by me).

item.title: Tubing
item.description: Below is some pretty good pointers if you ever find yourself on a river with a tube and beer in hand.
